EU-backed convention establishes commission to compensate Ukraine for Russian crimes
subhead: Thirty-four countries, joined by the European Union, have adopted, under the aegis of the Council of Europe, a convention creating a mechanism to compensate for the harm caused by the war waged by Moscow since February 2022.

Nick Reiner appears in court on murder charges while siblings speak of their loss
subhead: After the court hearing, Reiner's attorney, Alan Jackson, called the case 'a devastating tragedy that has befallen the Reiner family.' The 32-year-old has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder for the killing of his parents, director Rob Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer Reiner, who were found dead in their Los Angeles home on Sunday.

title: Mineral water fraud: Nestlé sued for €1.6 billion over 'unfair competition'
subhead: Le Monde has learned that Nestlé Waters is being sued by its competitor Bonneval Emergence, which is demanding that Perrier, Vittel, Contrex and Hépar waters be withdrawn from the market.

title: Actress Françoise Brion, New Wave icon, dies at age 92
subhead: A star of the 1960s films by Jacques Doniol-Valcroze and Pierre Kast, Paris-born Brion later led a more discreet career, regularly returning to the stage to perform the works of renowned playwrights.

title: 'Freed from the Western bogeyman, countries of the Global South would quickly be dominated by the Chinese superpower'
subhead: By attacking European allies, Donald Trump also weakens countries of the Global South, whose common denominator is their opposition to the powers of the North, observes Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: 'The New Yorker at 100': A certain idea of journalism, narrated by Julianne Moore
subhead: Marshall Curry's documentary takes viewers behind the scenes of the iconic American weekly magazine, which continues to thrive in the modern era.

title: 'Academic freedom at risk': The Danish university shaken by an anti-immigration cabal
subhead: Roskilde University found itself at the center of controversy over its programs, which were accused by both the far right and Social Democratic Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen of being a backdoor route to immigration for foreign students.
